title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 19 June 2013 - XWiki
content:
<polx> has quit  
00:29 <abusenius\_> has quit  
00:38 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
01:03 <kstuart> has quit  
01:05 <kstuart> has joined #xwiki  
01:44 <Denis> has quit  
02:18 <kstuart> has quit  
04:15 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
04:21 <polx> has quit  
04:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
05:50 <tekzilla> has quit  
05:51 <Denis> has quit  
05:52 <lynxt> has joined #xwiki  
05:52 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
05:54 <lynxt> has quit  
05:55 <lynxt> has joined #xwiki  
05:55 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
08:03 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:05 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:14 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:21 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:22 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:54 <msmeria> tmortagne: I get many Solr-related errors in the console on 5.1m2. see here for an example http://pastebin.com/S5hQsdCf Do you know about this bug or should I report it ?  
08:57 <tmortagne> msmeria: you won't have any version to report that on, will look at it. I think I just moved a nullpointer from one point to another which is caused by the fact that Solr receive an event about a property that does not exist  
08:58 <tmortagne> (which is not something new)  
08:58 <vmassol> has quit  
09:00 <msmeria> tmortagne: it happens on 5.1m2 so I could report it under that version if you want me to  
09:01 <tmortagne> msmeria: ha I read you message too quickly, I tough you were testing a snapshot  
09:01 <msmeria> :)  
09:01 <tmortagne> it's possible I fixed that yesterday actually  
09:02 <tmortagne> that's why I read your message too quickly, I tough I had introduce a new bug related to what I modified yesterday  
09:02 <msmeria> ok then I'll retest on a snapshot when I have time  
09:02 <msmeria> I understand  
09:02 <tmortagne> msmeria: you should probably test only snapshot  
09:02 <msmeria> there was a talk about this subject  
09:02 <msmeria> whether I should always test on the newest snapshot or not  
09:03 <msmeria> I'm supposed to test fully 5.1m2...  
09:03 <tmortagne> I must have missed that talk  
09:04 <tmortagne> I understand this for stable things but Solr is in progress and there is always several differences between last snapshot and last release  
09:05 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:05 <msmeria> I see. I want to ask Vincent about this too when he's online  
09:09 <sburjan`> has quit  
09:09 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
09:59 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:07 <vmassol> sburjan`: good morning, do we have a page listing all versions tested on test.xwiki.org?  
10:08 <vmassol> sburjan`: manuel is beating you http://test.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/QA/HallOfFame ;)  
10:10 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:12 <sburjan> vmassol: good morning. No, we don't have. If you want to see all versions a test has been run on, you have to go to the test's page  
10:13 <msmeria> vmassol: good morning. I spoke to tmortagne earlier this morning and he said I should always test on the latest snapshot. I know we talked about this some time ago, but nothing was decided. Do you want me to test on the latest snaps from now on ?  
10:14 <tmortagne> msmeria: what I said exactly is that testing M2 is useless for thing in progress like Solr  
10:14 <tmortagne> but in general I don't really see the point in testing a milestone as soon as there is modifications in the snapshot  
10:14 <vmassol> msmeria: yes, what's useful is to test before a release obviously so indeed testing latest is always better, you just need to be careful and sync with us when we have unstable things  
10:16 <msmeria> vmassol: ok then. I'll do that from now on  
10:16 <vmassol> which is why I mentioned being able to test timestamped snapshots with some verisioning like 5.1-<date>  
10:17 <vmassol> which is also why I asked for version filtering in the LT  
10:17 <vmassol> so that you can enter "5.1" and get all tests done during 5.1  
10:17 <vmassol> (during 5.1 dev I mean)  
10:17 <msmeria> makes sense  
10:20 <sburjan> vmassol: ATM is not implemented, and it's gonna be hard to make this filtrable/sortable  
10:41 <vmassol> has quit  
10:55 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:55 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
11:01 <vmassol> sburjan: we need filtering on columns of http://test.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/QA/XWiki+5.1+M2  
11:01 <vmassol> for ex, I wanted to see all tests done on oracle  
11:02 <sburjan> Ok, I'll try to do that ASAP  
11:02 <sburjan> FTM you can use sorting, at leasy toy'll have all the Oracle tests grouped  
11:11 <vmassol> tmortagne: do we have any doc on xwiki.org that explains version ranges for extensions what is supported?  
11:11 <vmassol> ludovic just asked me about this  
11:11 <vmassol> for ex are all the ranges from maven supported?  
11:11 <vmassol> http://docs.codehaus.org/display/MAVEN/Dependency+Mediation+and+Conflict+Resolution#DependencyMediationandConflictResolution-DependencyVersionRanges  
11:13 <tmortagne> vmassol: I don't think there is a doc no and yes all ranges from maven/aether are supported  
11:17 <tmortagne> it's basically a fork of AETHER version range parser but more extensible  
11:18 <tmortagne> and of course to not depend on aether  
11:19 <vmassol> yes I remember it wasn't based on aether which is why I wasn't sure about the support levle  
11:19 <vmassol> \*level  
11:20 <sburjan> tmortagne: it seems your commit fixed my issue  
11:20 <sburjan> the shutdown issue  
11:20 <vmassol> if you could add the doc somewhere on xwiki.org it would be great tmortagne  
11:20 <tmortagne> one difference is that 1.0 means "1.0 or more with a preference for 1.0" while in maven it means "I prefer 1.0 but if you have anything else it's ok too"  
11:20 <sburjan> now it seems working like a charm  
11:20 <tmortagne> sburjan: ok  
11:20 <tmortagne> vmassol: sure  
11:23 <sburjan> tmortagne: what was the actual thread blocking the shutdown ?  
11:24 <tmortagne> sburjan: not sure, I got a bunch or behavior that did not made any sense when debugging so I removed all the advanced code to stop the threads and just made them daemons  
11:25 <tmortagne> (daemon=you don't care they are running you can stop)  
11:30 <mflorea> tmortagne: Insufficient code coverage for INSTRUCTION: 48.99% < 49.00% on sorl API :) (close but not enough :) )  
11:30 <tmortagne> mflorea: yes I seen it  
12:04 <gdelhumeau> is it possible that the rendering of the document is done when I call doc.save() ?  
12:04 <gdelhumeau> because:  
12:04 <gdelhumeau> 2013-06-19 11:57:36,452 [DefaultQuartzScheduler\_Worker-6] ERROR o.q.c.JobRunShell              - Job DEFAULT.xw  
12:04 <gdelhumeau> java.lang.StackOverflowError: null  
12:04 <gdelhumeau>         at org.xwiki.rendering.block.match.MacroBlockMatcher.match(MacroBlockMatcher.java:55) ~[xwiki-rendering  
12:04 <gdelhumeau> -api-3.2.1.jar:na]  
12:04 <gdelhumeau>         at org.xwiki.rendering.block.AbstractBlock.addBlock(AbstractBlock.java:688) ~[xwiki-rendering-api-3.2.1.jar:na]  
12:04 <gdelhumeau>         at org.xwiki.rendering.block.AbstractBlock.getSiblingBlocks(AbstractBlock.java:643) ~[xwiki-rendering-api-3.2.1.jar:na]  
12:04 <gdelhumeau>         at org.xwiki.rendering.block.AbstractBlock.getBlocks(AbstractBlock.java:541) ~[xwiki-rendering-api-3.2.1.jar:na]  
12:04 <gdelhumeau>         at org.xwiki.rendering.block.AbstractBlock.getBlocks(AbstractBlock.java:737) ~[xwiki-rendering-api-3.2.1.jar:na]  
12:05 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
12:05 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
12:05 <mflorea> has quit  
12:05 <jrgill2> has joined #xwiki  
12:06 <jrgill> has quit  
12:06 <gdelhumeau> I'm trying to save a wiki page with a lot of contents containing "{{warning}}" macros, etc...  
12:07 <gdelhumeau> the exception occurs when I do doc.save()  
12:22 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: it's not because you are looking at Blocks that you are rendering something, the document content is parse when you save to find links among other things  
12:22 <tmortagne> s/parse/parsed/  
12:42 <gdelhumeau> Yes, that was I suspecting.  
12:43 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: so it's not possible to save a page that have too much content ?  
12:44 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: yes and no, you probably hit the same issue than XRENDERING-261 in your case  
12:44 <tmortagne> "too much content" is quite a lot of content now  
12:46 <tmortagne> to summarize XRENDERING-261 the issue was that blocks were parsed "too recursively"  
12:46 <tmortagne> one block leading to the following block etc until the stack is full  
12:47 <tmortagne> we don't use navigate recursively anymore in blocks in AbstractBlock methods  
12:47 <tmortagne> s/use//  
12:48 <tmortagne> vmassol: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/XWiki+Commons+-+Extension+-+Repository+-+Maven  
13:20 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:22 <vmassol> tmortagne: thanks, page name is a bit longish but ok ;) http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/XWiki+Commons+-+Extension+-+Repository+-+Maven  
13:22 <vmassol> I'll send the link to ludovic  
13:24 <vmassol> guys should we remove the jabber section on http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/IRC#HJabber ?  
13:25 <vmassol> do we still have the sync between irc and jabber?  
13:25 <vmassol> answer: no  
13:25 <vmassol> "The jabber channel is no longer used nor bridged to the IRC channel. If you join you will probably find it empty."  
13:25 <vmassol> I'll remove the section  
13:55 <vmassol> tmortagne: do you know if removing a wiki removes the descriptor page?  
13:55 <tmortagne> vmassol: depends what you mean by removing a wiki, if you remove a wiki using Wiki Manager api yes the descriptor is deleted otherwise it would not make sense  
13:56 <vmassol> ok cool  
13:56 <vmassol> we could have wanted to keep the descriptor but just make it disabled  
13:56 <tmortagne> remove the database and not the descriptor ?  
13:57 <vmassol> anyway all I was wanting is check if the descriptor page was removed so cool  
14:12 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: as a workaround, I now write html in my page in a single {{html}} macro. I hope it will works.  
14:13 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: you won't have the issue described in XRENDERING-261  
14:13 <tmortagne> but best is to use >5.0 of course  
14:14 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: client that have a 3.2.1 xwiki ;)  
14:14 <tmortagne> yea I guess  
14:19 <vmassol> guys what do you think to exclude the test wiki's TEstReportingExecutions space from notifications?  
14:22 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
14:25 <vmassol> hmm seems the bot is not honouring the excludes… checking why  
14:53 <sburjan> vmassol: I have a question about automated tests. I got rusty since I wrote my last automated test. I am creating a PO and I want to define an element using @FindBy(...), but I am not able to search by classname. Only id, xpath. I have also searched in the code for className and I can't find any usage. Do you have any idea why ?  
14:55 <sburjan> it seems className does the trick  
15:02 <evalica> has quit  
15:13 <vmassol> ok found the problem with the ircbot…. analyzing how to fix it  
15:15 <sburjan> vmassol: do we have PR on test. xwiki.org ? it seems that we modified a page which required PR and it's not working anymore  
15:15 <sburjan> could you re-save it ? http://test.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/QA/HallOfFame  
15:15 <vmassol> done  
15:16 <sburjan> could you give PR to me ?  
15:16 <sburjan> or better to both :)  
15:16 <sburjan> only on test. xwiki.org  
15:16 <vmassol> for that I'd need to give you PR to the whole farm as you know  
15:16 <vmassol> sburjan: you should know it's not possible  
15:16 <vmassol> if you don't know it means you've not tested this feature in your tests for XE :)  
15:16 <sburjan> pffffff  
15:17 <vmassol> it's done voluntarily of course  
15:17 <sburjan> didn't knew that PR is global  
15:18 <sburjan> one of the LT needs PR, so I'll ping you to re-save pages :)  
15:18 <vmassol> don't require PR  
15:18 <vmassol> that's even better  
15:18 <sburjan> unfortunately there was no other way  
15:18 <sburjan> I tried to avoid PR as much as possible  
15:22 <sburjan> vmassol: but is PR preserved when importing ? because I had no issue deploying the app on test.xwiki.org  
15:22 <vmassol> that's strange  
15:22 <sburjan> everything worked fine out of the box without having to ask somebody to save with PR  
15:23 <vmassol> I don't think that's normal  
15:23 <sburjan> I assumed I had PR, this is why I didn't asked myself :)  
15:26 <sburjan> actually the app was installed via EM, but don't know if that is relevant  
15:28 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
15:40 <vmassol> let's ask our security consultant tdelafosse!  
15:41 <tdelafosse> vmassol : At your service :)  
15:42 <tdelafosse> What's the issue ?  
15:46 <vmassol> sburjan: you have PR rights on the farl  
15:46 <vmassol> \*farm  
15:46 <sburjan> vmassol: did you gave me now or I had before ?  
15:46 <vmassol> you has before  
15:46 <vmassol> which is why it worked when you installed the app  
15:46 <sburjan> are you sure ? let me try to re-save the page  
15:47 <vmassol> yes sure  
15:47 <sburjan> because I re-saved hall of fame and it didn;t fixed the PR  
15:47 <sburjan> let me try again  
15:48 <sburjan> vmassol: seems to be working  
15:48 <sburjan> cool, so it was a false alarm :)  
15:49 <vmassol> next time check yourself, you're admin so you can check that :)  
15:50 <Slashman> hello, I'm using ldap as backend for xwiki and I'm looking for a quick way to force a synchronization since a group was updated in ldap and is linked to a group in xwiki, any idea ?  
15:54 <msmeria> has quit  
15:55 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
16:13 <sburjan> tmortagne, : I still get some stacktraces from time to time, especially when a test fails. http://pastebin.com/SKXWb4Lv  
16:14 <tmortagne> sburjan: that's because the cache is stopped before the indexer thread  
16:15 <tmortagne> it's anything that tries to get a document when XWiki is stopped, not only Solr  
16:22 <sdumitriu> has quit  
16:23 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
16:35 <Denis> has quit  
16:38 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
16:39 <vmassol> ok bot is going to be more quiet now :)  
16:39 <vmassol> (I hope not too quiet though...)  
16:39 <vmassol> !help  
16:41 <vmassol> ok seems to be working fine  
16:41 <vmassol> so FTR are now excluded:  
16:41 <vmassol> - scheduler triggers  
16:41 <vmassol> - playground wiki  
16:42 <vmassol> - test:TestReportingExecutions.\*  
16:42 <sburjan> vmassol: cool. with TestReportingExecutions.\* excluded, the Test App will not generate noise anymore  
17:03 <vmassol> has quit  
17:24 <tmortagne> has quit  
17:33 <motofix> has joined #xwiki  
17:37 <motofix> I would like to test if a user is in a specific group. I'm using $xwiki.getUser().isUserInGroup('test'), but it keeps return "false" despites the user currently logged-in is in the "test" group. Any idea?  
17:47 <motofix> Solved: I forgot to prefix group name by "XWiki."
